meta.title: BTracker: Real-time genomic epidemiology of Bacillus cereus sensu lato

Source_3.value: Soil (Ginseng field)

Free_Text.value: Type strain of Ectobacillus panaciterrae; outgroup to Bacillus cereus sensu lato (s.l.) group (NCBI TaxID: 86661)

Free_Text.value: Crystal-producing strain isolated from soil samples collected from Madurai district, Tamil Nadu, South India; soil samples were obtained from urban and semi-urban areas where B. thuringiensis- derived insecticides are not sprayed; toxic against 2 cancer cell lines, but nontoxic to normal lymphocytes; no insecticidal activity against lepidopteran and dipteran larvae

Source_3.value: Mohair wool linked to human anthrax cases

Free_Text.value: Mohair wool from cashmere processed in wool factory; per the BioProject: the strain was isolated in Switzerland, in 1981, during iterative cases of anthrax involving workers in a textile plant processing cashmere wool from the Indian subcontinent
